item.title: Assassin’s Creed Mirage Valley of Memory DLC Patch Notes—New Free Content, Gameplay Improvements, and More
item.content:encoded:
Assassin’s Creed Mirage’s Valley of Memory DLC update is going live on November 18 at  14:00 UTC / 10:00 AM EDT / 7:00 AM PT, introducing 6 hours of new content, many significant gameplay improvements, and some fixes.

The Valley of Memory’s Trophy List was revealed a few days ago, providing a complete list of trophies and achievements players can target. Now, Title Update 1.1.0 is going live for AC Mirage, introducing the new free DLC and a substantial update. The update’s size according to platforms is as follows: PlayStation 5 – 22.6GB, PlayStation 4 – 16.6GB, Xbox Series X/S – 32.39GB, Xbox One – 10.11GB, PC – 28.15GB.

What’s New in Assassin’s Creed Mirage Title Update 1.1.0 Valley of Mirage DLC

New Free Content

Assassin’s Creed Mirage Valley of Memory DLC comes as a free update for all players, taking them on a new adventure with Basim. Basim has heard something about his long-lost father still being alive, and chasing these rumours, he has reached the new region, AlUla, “a land of secrets, ancient ruins, and vibrant oases. Players will have to complete the “Head of the Snake” mission to access this content. New game players have the option to skip ahead in the story directly through the main menu.

The region of AlUla will feature hours of content that players can explore, including new and returning world activities, family-friendly side activities, world events, work contracts, and brand-new additions. Some of these additions have been named, including Stolen Goods and Oud Melodies, the first mission asks you to stal maps from robbers and the second has players collect musical scenes through parkour sequences.

Gameplay Improvements

As mentioned above, players will observe some significant gameplay improvements in Assassin’s Creed Mirage after title update 1.1.0. Firstly, the free jump option has been included, allowing players to jump manually by pressing a button. Side and back ejects can now be performed even when Basim has no clear area to land on or has a handhold. The “Free” mode can be toggled on/off, and “Safe” mode can be used if you prefer safe and sound landings for Basim.

The Assassin’s Creed Mirage Valley of Memory DLC update will also introduce replayable missions, known as Animus Sequences. These missions will present new challenges that can be completed for rewards, including Animus Mods. These mods are essential auto-refills for your tools and resources, which can only be used in this mode or New Game+.

Two new difficulties have also been added: Hardened Assassin, which comes between Assassin (Normal) and Master Assassin (Hard). Ultra Hardened is the new hardest difficulty, and there is also a new Custom Difficulty preset for a more tailored experience. The DLC also adds a tier 3 tool upgrade, with Throwing Knives becoming explosive, Smoke Bomb becoming corrosive and disolving dead enemies, Blow Darts piercing through heavily armored enemies, Noiskmakes putting enemies to sleep in the impact zone, and Traps can make enemies attack their fellow guards.

There are additional improvements, additions, which you can check out in the full patch notes below:

Assassin’s Creed Mirage Title Update 1.1.0 Full Patch Notes

GAMEPLAY

  • Added a new skill to the skill tree: Engineer 2 which allows players to equip all tool lvl1 upgrades.
  • Added an option to cancel the chain kill once started.
  • Added new objects that can only be looted by pickpocketing in AlUla.
  • Rebalanced the notoriety system to coincide with new difficulty settings.
  • Tool aim assist will now correctly snap to the target’s weak points while behind an enemy. Now you have no excuses…

COMBAT

  • Added an opportunity to dodge a Shakiriyya attack after being parried.
  • Modified the Light Attack slash VFX to make the attacks feel more impactful.
  • Improved the flinch animation on the NPCs during light attacks.
  • Increased the window of opportunity to perform a kick.
  • Disabled blend on parry success animation so it feels more responsive.
  • Increased the size of the parry VFX.

PARKOUR

  • Improved the trigger condition of the ejects.
  • Modified the camera and added a VFX to improve the feeling of speed while sprinting.

UI

  • Added a button on the world map to fast travel between Baghdad and AlUla once the AlUla questline starts.
  • Updated the objective icons design and descriptions within the quest log to reinforce the differences between the types of objectives.
  • Removed the skill point notification remaining on screen when there are available skill points to rely on the “new” notification from skill tab.
  • Added an “upgradable tool” icon when a tool can be upgraded. Displayed next to the Bureau icons, on the map & compass for Banu Musa and the Workbench.
  • Reduced the size of the Ubisoft Connect notifications.
  • Added a new tutorial panel and Codex entry explaining Defense tactics in combat.
  • Made various adjustments to improve the Horse mount camera.

LIST OF BUG FIXES

GAMEPLAY

  • All claimed rewards are now linked to the player account save. For instance: any reward claimed in Permadeath will now be accessible to all the saves on the player’s account.
  • Modified how to access permadeath: it can now only be initiated when starting a New Game+, rather than at any time.
  • Prevented players from falling on a specific ledge in Baghdad.

UI

  • Resolved an issue where the Options menu would be offset after talking with a merchant with text size set to Large.
  • Fixed an issue where the “Assassin’s Creed Franchise” button would lead to a page stating that there is no content available.
  • Numbers in some item descriptions are no longer split when the text is displayed as Large in Japanese language.
  • Fixed the localization of “Basim Valhalla Costume” in Traditional Chinese.

VISUALS & GRAPHICS

  • Addressed an issue where the world would look dimmer with almost no highlights after turning on HDR.
  • Fixed an issue where the Desync screen on PS5 Pro would display broken visuals.
  • The draped golden fabric of the Dhahabi Master Assassin Costume now moves freely like other costumes.

STABILITY

Fixed rare issues that could create crashes.

The patch notes for Assassin’s Creed Mirage’s Valley of Memory update were made available through a post on r/assassinscreed.

In other news, the release date for Assassin’s Creed: Shadows on Nintendo Switch 2 has been revealed. Additionally, the Former Assassin’s Creed Boss confirms Ubisoft asked him to ‘step aside‘. item.title: Hytale Is Back After Being Reacquired By Hypixel Studios
item.content:encoded:
Hypixel Studios is back, and they have brought an old friend along with it. On Monday, founder Simon Collins-Laflamme announced that they had reacquired the rights to sandbox game Hytale from Riot Games.

The news comes roughly five months since it was announced that the game was being shut down.

“We are thrilled to announce that we have acquired Hytale from Riot Games,” Collins-Laflamme said. “While it didn’t make sense for them to continue developing it in its existing form, they ultimately wanted what’s best for players, and that’s for us to eventually play a revised version of the game. We are grateful to Riot Games for making this possible.”

Collins-Laflamme said that the studio has hired “more than 30 developers who know this game inside and out, with additional returns in the coming days.”

He says that the team is going to go back to the original version of what Hytale was supposed to be. It was added that the studio is fully independent and committed to funding Hytale “for the next 10 years”.

As far as what’s next, an Early Access release and pricing will be announced “in the coming days”. It’ll be available first on Windows with a Mac and Linux release possible and other platforms later on. Regarding content, the Early Access version of Hytale will include a Creative Mode, Exploration Mode, and Modding capabilities. What won’t be available are minigames and an Adventure Mode. Both of those will come later on.

item.title: Helldivers CEO Comments on Switch 2 Port
item.content:encoded:
Arrowhead Games Studio’s CEO recently commented on a possible Switch 2 port for Helldivers 2, stating ‘We’ll see’.

It is no secret that Helldivers 2’s port to Xbox has significantly helped the game, with the developers revealing that the new platform has increased sales and engagement for the PC and PS5 versions of the game. So that sets a precedent for Helldivers 2 to be released on another platform, but the developers haven’t officially confirmed anything yet.

Helldivers 2 on Switch 2 Could be a Possibility?

The comments on Helldivers 2 coming to Switch 2 came through the latest episode of the Game Business Show on YouTube (via Game Rant), where Christopher Dring interviewed Shams Jorjani, Arrowhead CEO. During this interview, Dring jokingly spoke about waiting for a ‘Switch 2 version’ for the game, to which Jorjan responded, stating, “We’ll see, we’ll see. That’s again, above my pay grade by a couple of tiers.”

We already know that the Xbox port worked wonders for the game, selling more on the new platform than PlayStation in the first six days. However, will Helldivers 2 be able to find a similar kind of success on Switch 2, that is not yet known. At the same time, the developers are currently hard at work to optimise the game, working not only to address several performance issues but also to decrease the install size and improve load times.

item.title: The Game Awards 2025—All Award Nominees
item.content:encoded:
The nominees for The Game Awards 2025 have been announced. For more than a decade, the show, hosted by Geoff Keighley, celebrates the year’s best games and highlights the future of the industry. With 2025 being as great a year for game releases, there were already some tight competition. Now, we know just what stood out for outlets and the judges.

All of the categories were voted on by a panel of judges from various outlets. The winners are mostly chosen by that group, but fans can vote for their favorites on the site as well. However, the biggest category that’s fully fan-voted is Player’s Voice. Nominations for the category will be announced at a later date. Last year, Astro Bot won Game of the Year, with Metaphor: ReFantazio and Balatro winning several awards as well.
